cab.content: [This document is the Property o His Britannic Majesty's Government.] Printed for the Cabinet. October 1932.SECRET.CP. 346 (32). Copy No........... CABINET.Reports by Local Governments on the Political Situation in India. I circulate for the information of my colleagues the latest weekly reports from theLocal Governments in India. S. H. INDIA OFFTCE, 18th October 1932.Delhi. The week has been quiet. Section 3: arrests, 1 ; total detained, 3. Section 4:fresh orders, 1. Total to date in respect of whom orders are in force, 41 ; convictionsto date for contravening orders, 10.Bombay. The situation in districts generally is unchanged, but there has been some revival of instigation to non-payment of land revenue in the Bardoli Taluka rof the SuratDistrict. In Bombay city attempts to end the deadlock in the cotton trade led to anincrease of picketing and 79 picketers were arrested during the week. Ordinance 10.Section 3 : arrests, 13 ; total under detention, 63. Section 4 : orders, 63 ; total inforce, 950. Section 17 : convictions, 11.Bengal. The civil disobedience situation is quiet. Statistics are, however, incompleteowing to the Puja holidays.Madras. The situation remains quiet and unchanged.Central Provinces. The week has been entirely quiet. Prosecutions, 4 ; convictions, 8.United Provinces. The week has been quiet and marked by little Congress activity, apart from somepicketing in Cawupore and Benares, and the stopping of a couple trains. The Dasehrapassed off without any trouble. Section 3 Ordinance has not been used. Threeorders have been issued under section 4, and one conviction has been made fordefying orders under that section. Convictions during the week : under Ordinance,13; under ordinary law, 65. Grand total up to date, 12,074; released onapologies, 2,965.Punjab. The Province continues to be quiet and the civil disobedience movement remainsnegligible. Political arrests : under ordinary law, 2 ; under Ordinances, 6. Otherfigures are unchanged.North-West Frontier Province. Section 3 : arrests, nil ; total detained, 4. Section 4 : orders, 1 ; total orders inforce, 52. Chitral relief has been completed without incident and the troops detailedin support are now dispersing. A Shamozai jirga is coming in to interview thePolitical Agent, Malakand. 1306 60 10.3-2 Bihar and Orissa. There is nothing to report. Five orders under Special Powers Ordinance are sin force. The number of convictions up to 8th October is 10,344. Reports from iidistricts have not been received.Assam. There is nothing to report.Ajmer Merwara. There is nothing to report, and no arrests have been made.Prom the Kesident, Mysore. The weekly report from Ooorg and Bangalore is the same as last week.
